review_blob: Bottle from La Caisse de Bire, Courbevoie - FR. Color: clear golden blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: fruity and sweet nose. Peach and litchi nose. Caramel malt balance. Taste: medium body with fruity notes balanced with malt and wet bitterness. Standard IPA like many of them in Paris... Nothing special. Superb drinkable but really standard. Aftertaste: mango and wet bitterness.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: opaque red purple beer with no carbonation and really small white foam. Smell: lassi nose domination, lactic and sourness. Taste: light body with raspberry juice blast. Very intensive taste. Balanced with tart taste and superb sourness. Very great equilibrium. I really like it. Astringent taste and really fruity finish. Amazing ! Aftertaste: astringent with raspberry. Superb fruity and lactic finish. I didnt like so much the mango version but this one is really brilliant !

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear golden blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam, quiet none. Smell: apple juice, sourness, cider domination. Saison yeast. Oak notes. Sweet fruity finish. Taste: medium malt body with sweet apple taste. Astringent saison yeast notes. Finish as apple juice and alcohol notes. Aftertaste: caramel and astringent with saison yeast and alcohol notes.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear golden blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: very sweet fruits attack, peach and mango with litchi hint. Taste: medium body with caramel and fruity taste. Really nice peach and mango taste. Very intensive and really nice attenuation. Superb taste. Aftertaste: wet bitterness and mango finish.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear copper amber beer with no carbonation and medium ivory white foam. Smell: resin domination, fruity and caramel notes. Mango and peach. Taste: light/medium body with resin blast. Caramel and pine hint. Very intensive caramel resin. Good attenuation and drinkable. Its really nice for a session IPA to have resin and pine taste. I like it. Aftertaste: caramel, resin and watery bitterness.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear golden blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: mango and peach nose. Small sourness balance. Very fresh notes. Taste: light body with nice fruity taste balanced with acidity. Hoppy presence and astringent. Finish as fruity and mango. Really nice taste. Not so tart. Aftertaste: astringent and watery mango notes. Bitterness. Wow!

Bottle from La Moustache Blanche, Paris - FR. Color: dark black beer with brown reflection no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: smoked malt attack, very intensive smoked ham and smoked wood nose. Small roasted malt. Taste: light body with smoked and roasted malt taste. Very intensive smoked notes, quick clean by astringent saison yeast. Very interesting beer. Superb concept and very imaginative, but not easy drinkable to intensive and complex flavor for a high drinkability. Aftertaste: roasted and smoked notes, astringent and bitterness. Good beer but to complex ! Nice batch :)

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear dark amber beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: malt, caramel and fruity notes. Peach and mango notes. High hoppy presence. Taste: medium body caramel and sweet malt. Sweet notes balanced with high bitterness. Small pine hint, really fruity. Very nice finish and easy drinkable. Aftertaste: sweet caramel and bread notes. Superb amber ale !

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear copper amber beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: candied fruits, candy and caramel domination. Alcohol barrel notes. Rotten fruits notes. Very superb bouquet and floral presence. Alcohol finish. Taste: full body with high caramel attack with astringent alcohol, fruity notes and candied fruits. Very intensive and high bitterness. Super aroma bouquet. Really amazing beer. Aftertaste: high bitterness and alcohol with rotten fruits. I love it !

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear shiny amber beer with no carbonation and medium ivory head. Smell: caramel and toffee domination. Caramel malt. Sweet notes. Taste: medium body with caramel malt. Toffee domination, very nice malt taste. Very well balanced. I like this. Easy drinkable for the ABV. Good attenuation and nice hoppy balance. Aftertaste: caramel and toffee with fruity notes and bitterness.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: pale golden blond beer with no carbonation and really small white foam. Smell: pineapple domination, pineapple juice. Exotic notes as mango. Sourness finish. Taste: light body with pineapple attack balanced with acidity and sourness. Bitterness and hoppy notes. Good attenuation, astringent finish. Aftertaste: astringent bitterness, acidity and fruity notes.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: roasted malt, caramel notes. Black bread, grassy and herbal. Finish hoppy. Taste: medium body with roasted and caramel malt, well balanced with grassy hops. Nice floral notes and superb attenuation. Easy drinkable very nice beer and well balanced. Aftertaste: roasted malt, chocolate and wet bitterness.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: dark amber beer with no carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: resin attack and pine domination. Very intensive resin with caramel and alcohol finish. Taste: full body with resin blast, pine explosion. Very intensive resin hops, alcohol. Astringent attenuation and high bitterness. This beer is palate burner... Intensive and difficult to drink. Very bad balance its just resin and alcohol. Aftertaste: resin, astringent bitterness and alcohol.

Bottle from La Moustache Blanche, Paris - FR. Color: golden blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: rich hoppy nose. Fruity as well, fresh sensation. Mango and peach notes. Caramel and sweet notes. Taste: medium body with caramel malt balanced with high fruity taste. Really nice beer, mango and peach. So fruity, well balanced and easy drinkable. What else for a beer... Aftertaste: fresh hops and fruity, wet bitterness. THIS BEER IS NOT A SAISON BUT AN AMERICAN PALE ALE !

Bottle from Le Cellier des Arcades, Arras - FR. Color: hazy golden blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: grass, hops and resin. Pine hint. Taste: medium body with caramel malt, grassy and hoppy. Floral notes and finish resin. Aftertaste: wet bitterness and pine. Can be better...

Bottle from Deconinck, Vichte - BE. Color: clear amber beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: caramel and sweet domination. Toffee and candy. Bread notes and sugar finish. Taste: full body with caramel malt and toffee with sweet candy notes. Good attenuation. Ester notes. Candied fruits. Aftertaste: caramel malt and bread. Alcohol and yeast. Nice tripel, but not the best.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear golden amber blond beer with no carbonation and really small white head, quiet inexistant. Smell: barrel, grapes, white wine. Sweet caramel and fruity, candied fruits. Finish caramel. Taste: medium body with caramel taste, alcohol notes with grapes and white wine barrel. Really bitter, pine hint. Very nice structure. Take is not so fresh, from the fridge its a nightmare to drink. Aftertaste: wooden taste, grapes, white wine. Astringent, high bitterness and resin. Very interesting beer ! Superb concept, bravo !

Bottle from Cash Flandres Artois, Bruay - FR. Color: clear amber beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: caramel malt, toffee and caramel with alcohol notes. Taste: medium body with caramel malt, really sweet candy notes. Good attenuation with alcohol finish.

beer_brewer_name: Les Brasseurs du Grand Paris (My Beer Company)
review_blob: Bottle from La Moustache Blanche, Paris - FR. Color: golden blond beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: citrus and lemon attack, hoppy nose. Sweet presence. Taste: medium body with citrus notes. Lemon taste and hoppy. High attenuation. Quiet easy drinkable. Aftertaste: wet bitterness and citrus notes.
beer_name: Les Brasseurs du Grand Paris Citron Givr

review_blob: On tap @ La Trappe - NL. Color: hazy golden blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: candied fruits and sweet malt. Candy notes and toffee. Very intensive ester. Interesting beer. Taste: full body with candy and sweet malt. Toffee notes and candied fruits. Very intensive with high attenuation. Alcohol finish. Aftertaste: dry bitterness, fruity and toffee.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: hazy golden blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: sweet caramel and fruity notes. Sweet floral balance. Taste: medium body with caramel malt and floral taste. Really fresh and fruity. Good attenuation, wet hoppy bitterness. Aftertaste: wet bitterness, peach notes and floral finish.

Bottle from Cash Flandres Artois, Auchy-les-Mines - FR. Color: clear golden copper amber beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: caramel malt domination. Candied fruits as banana and apricot. Fruity and ester nose. Taste: full body with caramel malt domination. Toffee notes and ester with banana finish. Very sweet beer, toffee finish. Aftertaste: caramel and toffee. Ester, alcohol.

On tap @ La Fine Mousse, Paris - FR. Color: hazy golden blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: grassy and fruity as apricot and peach notes. Ester and yeast finish. Taste: medium body with caramel sweet malt balanced with apricot and white fruits taste. Mango notes. Very tasty and ester finish. Easy drinkable and superb attenuation. Aftertaste: dry and fruity taste. Astringent and ester.
beer_name: Le Trou du Diable Saison du Tracteur

review_blob: On tap @ Le Supercoin, Paris - FR. Color: clear golden blond beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: nice hoppy and grassy nose. Balanced with fruity and apricot notes. Taste: medium body with hoppy and fruity taste. Small malt finish. Superb attenuation and really easy drinkable. Fresh and hoppy. Aftertaste: wet bitterness and mango.

On tap @ La Fine Mousse, Paris - FR. Color: hazy golden blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: grassy nose, hoppy presence. Small acidity notes. Taste: medium body with grassy notes, hoppy presence. Balanced with dry sourness. Very interesting taste. Good attenuation and really drinkable. Aftertaste: grassy and dry bitterness.

On tap @ LExpress de Lyon, Paris - FR. Color: golden blond beer with no carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: fruity and hoppy nose. Caramel balance. Taste: medium body with caramel malt balanced with grassy and fruity hoppy taste. Easy drinkable and good attenuation. Aftertaste: wet bitterness.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: hazy golden blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: caramel malt and apricot. Small hoppy notes. Taste: light body with caramel malt attack, sweet notes with apricot balanced with hoppy bitterness. Easy drinkable. Aftertaste: fruity and dry bitterness.
beer_name: Basqueland Aupa All United Pale Ale

beer_brewer_name: Les Brasseurs du Grand Paris (My Beer Company)
review_blob: On tap @ LExpress de Lyon, Paris - FR. Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt and black bread notes. Vanilla balance. Crme Brle notes. Taste: medium body with roasted malt and roasted caramel balanced with vanilla. Easy drinkable and tasty very nice beer. Aftertaste: vanilla and caramel with roasted malt.
beer_name: Les Brasseurs du Grand Paris Porter Gourmande

review_blob: On tap @ ALBCALB, Paris - FR. Color: clear golden blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: grapefruit domination, acidity and fruity as well. Grassy and sweet balance. Taste: medium body with nice fruity attack, grapefruits and nice grassy hops. Good attenuation with small acidity and sourness. Hoppy finish. Aftertaste: grapefruits and wet bitterness with small sourness.

On tap @ La Caisse de Bire, Courbevoie - FR. Color: amber beer with no carbonation and medium ivory head. Smell: sweet caramel with hoppy balance. Grassy and fruity notes. Taste: medium body with caramel malt balanced with grassy notes. Very standard APA. Nothing special. Easy drinkable. Aftertaste: caramel and wet bitterness.

Bottle shared @ Le Supercoin, Paris - FR. Color: golde blond beer with medium carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: caramel malt and yeast notes. Fruits. Taste: medium body with sweet malt balanced with fruity and nice bitterness; Really drinkable with superb attenuation. Very nice beer. Aftertaste: sweet malt and fruits.

On tap @ Le Supercoin, Paris - FR. Color: cloudy pale blond beer with no carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: fruity and grapes attack. Domination of Sorachi Ace. Taste:medium body with caramel balanced with fruity hops. Really easy drinkable. Perfect attenuation. Mango and grapes as finish. Aftertaste: wet bitterness.

Bottle @ Le Supercoin, Paris - FR. Color: deep amber beer with small carbonation and medium ivory head. Smell: high pine and resin hops. Caramel notes. Small alcohol finish. Taste: full body with high caramel and sweet malt attack, balanced with resin and pine hops. Grassy notes. Pine attenuation. Aftertaste: pine and resin with caramel and dry bitterness.

Bottle from La Caisse de Bire, Courbevoie - FR. Color: clear golden blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: fruity as well, grassy and hoppy. IPA nose. Peach finish. Taste: medium body with sweet malt balanced with exotic fruits peach and mango. Wet bitterness. Good balance. Standard IPA. Aftertaste: wet bitterness.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: hazy pale golden blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: sweet fruity nose, chewing-gum notes with grapes finish and small grassy sourness. Taste: light body with dry sensation, white grapes, fruity balanced with bubble gum finish; Very nice. Good attenuation. Sweet and fruity finish. Aftertaste: bubble gum, fruity. Sweet peach. Astringent sourness.

beer_brewer_name: Les Brasseurs du Grand Paris (My Beer Company)
review_blob: Bottle from La Caisse de Bire, Courbevoie - FR. Color: clear golden blond beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: smoked malt, smoked wood and smoked ham notes. Finish grassy and fruity as hoppy beer. Taste: medium body with sweet taste balanced with smoked malt, smoked ham notes. Finish as hoppy and fruity. Aftertaste: wet bitterness, fruity. The smoked beer is a brilliant idea but a hoppy finish is destroying the balance...
beer_name: Les Brasseurs du Grand Paris Smoke on the Water (>2014)

review_blob: Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: opaque hazy blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: really fruity, mango and litchi with sweet domination. Taste: medium body with really sweet taste, mango and litchi with peach notes. Very intensive exotic fruit. Superb fruity attenuation. Milky notes. Aftertaste: fruity and dry bitterness. Exotic notes.

On tap @ Paname Brewing Company, Paris - FR. Color: deep dark black beer with caramel reflection, no carbonation and small ivory creamy foam. Smell: roasted malt and caramel notes with grassy and floral hops finish. Nice Black IPA nose. Taste: medium body with roasted malt attack well balanced with grassy hops. Really fresh its a nice Black IPA. Good attenuation and easy drinkable. Aftertaste: roasted malt and coffee finish. High wet bitterness, grassy notes.

On tap @ Paname Brewing Company, Paris - FR. Color: clear golden blond beer with copper reflection and small carbonation, small white foam. Smell: caramel malt and fruity nose. Malt notes and bread. Taste: medium body with caramel malt and bread notes. Balanced with fruity notes. Its like a hoppy lager. Easy drinkable. Aftertaste: fruity as litchi and mango.

Tap @ Roadburn 2016, Tilburg - NL. Color: clear brown amber beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: caramel domination, resin and sweet. Taste: medium body, caramel and sweet malt domination. Really sweet taste. Aftertaste: sweet taste, caramel and toffee. Not so balanced too sweet.

Bottle from A la Bire comme  la Bire, Paris - FR. Color: deep dark brown red beer with no carbonation and high ivory foam. Smell: fruity and hoppy, grassy notes and small resin finish. Taste: medium body with fruity notes, small hoppy and resin finish. Good attenuation. Really fruity finish, ester notes. Aftertaste: fruity and wet bitterness.

Bottle vintage 2012 from LAbbaye des Saveurs (2014) - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: roasted malt and coffee balanced with pine and resin hops. Taste: full body with roasted malt and coffee, pine and resin with caramel hops. Good attenuation. Coffee notes and resin finish. Aftertaste: resin and high bitterness, astringent and coffee. Very nice beer.

Bottle from Deconinck, Vichte - BE. Color: deep dark brown beer with no carbonation and medium brow head. Smell: sweet toasted malt notes, caramel and nuts. Hazelnut notes. Toasted bread. Taste: bull body with really sweet toasted malt and caramel notes. Nuts and hazelnuts notes. Very intensive taste. Chocolate notes. Good attenuation and quiet drinkable. Aftertaste: sweet caramel and nuts.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear golden blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: hoppy and grassy with caramel and toffee notes. Honey finish. Taste: medium body with caramel malt and honey attack balanced hoppy and floral notes. Good attenuation and easy drinkable. Aftertaste: wet bitterness, caramel and toffee.
beer_name: Green Flash Hop Odyssey 30th Street Pale Ale

review_blob: Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: cloud pale white blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: wheat domination, whit high hoppy balance. Finish as spicy (coriander?). Taste: medium body with wheat attack balanced with hops and fruit notes. Good attenuation and easy drinkable. Finish spicy as orange zest and coriander. Aftertaste: wet bitterness, sweet wheat and orange.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: raisin, rotten raisin, roasted malt, coffee. Taste: full body with roasted malt and coffee. Raisin notes and strange grassy and herbal taste. Aftertaste: coffee and strange herbal. I dont like it, maybe bad batch.

Bottle from Labbaye des Saveurs, Lille - FR. Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt, coffee and mocha. Barrel aged. Oak notes. Taste: full body with really intensive mocha coffee malt. Amazing balance.This beer is a treasure. Mocha finish. Good bitterness. Aftertaste: mocha and coffee roasted malt. Bitterness and barrel aged. Alcohol finish. Really near to a Mocha Bomb from De Struise. Thanks for this !

Bottle from Deconinck, Vichte - BE. Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: peat domination and whiskey barrel. Very intensive. Roasted malt and alcohol finish. Taste: full body with really intensive whiskey barrel notes. Really peat presence. Amazing. Good balance superb taste. Aftertaste: peat and roasted malt. Coffee notes. Whiskey and barrel. Alcohol. Very amazing !
beer_name: De Molen Hel & Verdoemenis Bruichladdich BA

review_blob: Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: hazy dark amber beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: caramel and candied fruits. Belgian yeast and roasted nuts. Taste: medium body with caramel malt and candied fruits. Roasted nuts and finish as belgian yeast. Small effervescence on tongue. Aftertaste: caramel and apricot with candied apricot. Ester and finish sweet as well.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: cloudy golden blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell : nice fruity taste, candied fruits. Belgian yeast. Caramel malt. Sweet and nice. Taste: medium body with nice fruity taste. Very intensive candied fruits as apricot and peach. Peanut notes. Nice attenuation and really drinkable. Aftertaste: Apricot and peach, yeast notes. Esther. Very nice!
